document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the amphiamerican genus Mysidium Dana, 1852 (Crustacea: Mysida: Mysidae), with descriptions of two new species and the establishment of two new subgenera

subSubSection.paragraph: Gulf of California , Punta Marcial, 25.5167° N , 111.0167° W ( Harrison & Bowman 1987 ).

caption.paragraph:
Table 2. Diagnostic characters of the species of
Mysidium Dana, 1852
.

tr.th: Cornea diameter is (x)–times 1.7–3.2 length of terminal segment of an- tennular trunk in dorsal view
Total numbers of setae on and close to medio-terminal exten- sion of male antennular trunk (Fig. 1B)

outer face of terminal segment of

tr.th: Endopod of fourth male pleopod with (n) setae
Lateral margins of telson with spines (1) or laminae (2)
Numbers of spines or laminae on each lateral margin of telson

Telson with distinct apical cleft separating two broadly rounded, apical lobes (0) versus telson with shallow terminal indentation (1), traverse terminal margin (2), convex terminal margin (3), or ending in a triangular projection (4)
Terminal margin of telson with series of acutely pointed (1) versus blunt (2) laminae or spines
Numbers of laminae or spines on terminal margin of telson

paragraph.tableNote: Original data and from 1) Harrison & Bowman 1987; 2) Ortiz et al . 2017a, 2017b; 3) Băcescu 1991; 1, 2, 3) data partly derived from figures.

subSubSection.paragraph: segment occupying 58% total length. Endopod reduced to lobe with = 11% sympod length; apically with one long seta and more proximally six additional, smaller setae. Uropodal endopod 0.6–0.7 times as long as exopod. Telson linguiform, tapering posteriorly, length 1.9 times maximum width near basis; lateral margins slightly convex, almost straight; terminal margin clearly convex, well rounded. Proximal half of lateral margins smooth, distal half with dense series of 30–37 short, blunt or pointed spines on each side; lateral margins each with about 19 spines, terminal margin with about 24 spines.
